storyInfo: After many years, Theresis finally prepares for his departure to Londinium. Ascalon attempts to stop him, to no avail. Theresa believes in the future of Babel.

attributes.content: Early 1094
The nomadic city of Kazdel, Kazdel
Please wait, General!
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: You are too impatient.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: But General! The Duke's envoy was almost ready to spit on—
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Did we get what we wanted?
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: We got partial usage rights for the industrial area and the right to cross the border... but did it have to be so humiliating?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: The Victorian dukes have you at their beck and call, treating us Sarkaz like tamed beasts. This is not what our soldiers redeployed from the civil war were promised, General!
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Is this not all that we desired?
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Perhaps you would prefer the Victorians treat the Sarkaz as their greatest enemy from the beginning, banding together to face us?
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: I understand. I know it's necessary for our enemies to think us weak, but this...
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Many within our ranks feel this is terribly dishonorable—
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Did I promise them honor?
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Do the Sarkaz have honor in the eyes of the Victorians?
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: You have been far too impetuous lately, Manfred.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Dignity is of high import.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: You fight for the rights of your men, and thus do people respect you. Were these ordinary times, perhaps I too would commend you.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: But do you remember what we are here to do? We are preparing to steal the heart of a nation.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: To bring the greatest empire on this great land to its knees.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Their prejudices have left them weak, and the Sarkaz are in hunger.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: What we truly need is neither honor nor respect.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: ...I understand.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Are our men prepared?
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Ready to depart at a moment's notice. Our people sent in advance to Londinium will support us.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: The final deadline for our arrival as dictated by the Duke of Cavendish's request is fast approaching. We can set out at any time.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Good.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Then we march to destroy Victoria.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Have you been on duty this entire time?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Yes, sir.
attributes.name: Military Commission Guard

attributes.content: Stand down for now. I wish to be alone for a while.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Of course, sir.
attributes.name: Military Commission Guard

attributes.content: Once the guards leave, Manfred takes out a wine glass he had placed to the side.
Care for a drink?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: You never drank before.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: I still don't.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: But the General has ordered me to learn Victorian 'etiquette', all preparation for our upcoming duty.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: I have learnt rather recently that every meal those nobles pair every meal with multiple kinds of wine, each requiring its own unique glass.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Remember when we were young and the General led us to an ancient battlefield for swordplay? The night was cold, and only after the General made some soup did we realize we had nothing to hold it in.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Thankfully, the battlefield was nothing short of spent shells, and you used those to fashion four cups.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: You, me, the General, and Her Highness, carrying cups made out of shell casings while sitting in front of the fire.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: I remember. It was a peaceful night.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Just like this one.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: The frigid moonlight of late winter falls through the window. Manfred rests his hand upon his sword hilt that was equally as cold.
The air is still, and the two of them can hear the other's heartbeat.
You're going to Londinium tomorrow.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: I know you wished to see the General.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: And you couldn't. Otherwise, you wouldn't have come to see me.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: I gave up.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: I found that when I caught a glimpse of him from a distance, the first thought that came to my mind was that I should kill him, there and then.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Then you should applaud yourself for maintaining some reason.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: And so you decided to come to me?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: I heard you've improved your swordsmanship. Why don't we see for ourselves?
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: I've never been able to best you.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Don't beg for mercy before you've even fallen.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: There was the one time we fought in Her Highness's study.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: We knocked down an entire bookshelf, and the General took our weapons away and made us tidy up the room within thirty minutes.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: I knew that you did it on purpose, wanting attention from Their Highnesses.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Is that so?
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Ascalon hides herself away into the shadows in the blink of an eye.
Another blink, and Manfred feels a chill running across the side of his neck.
He didn't have the time to draw his sword and fight back. He didn't have the time to even think about fighting back.
Perhaps he was too tired?
If I cut your neck here, at least there will be no need for you to die in Londinium. I can just throw your corpse into the furnace.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: It would spare many from dying on a distant battlefield in a foreign land.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: If you've made your decision, then kill me here. It will be your final chance.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: You've made yours, I see.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: The General says you lack conviction, but I don't think he is entirely correct.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: You shouldn't speak so much when someone has your life in her hands.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: It is only recently that I've realized I'm not as resolute as you.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: We have been brought to where we are by the invisible tides of fate, but ever since the day this war started... There is no going back for us.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Then do your best to survive.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: I won't hold back next time.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: The silent assassin stows her blade up her sleeve, then slowly steps back into the shadows.
...Neither will I.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: If only this was our last meeting.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Rhodes Island of Babel, Kazdel
A cold wind scatters the thick clouds of late winter, allowing sunlight to peek through the gaps and spread out across the bridge of the ship.
Down the stairs, Ascalon stands unmoving by a guardrail.
She shuts her eyes tight, enjoying the fleeting warmth of the sunshine.
Above the stairs, there is a clear rustling of cloth dragging against the ground.
A shadow flit across the assassin's face, blocking out the rays of sunlight.
Sorry Ascalon, did I disturb your rest?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I thought I wouldn't make any sound, if I took off my shoes.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: No. You are welcome at any time.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: The ground's cold. You should put your shoes back on, Your Highness.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Nothing you wish to tell me, Ascalon?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: You mean...?
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: The reason you returned to Kazdel.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: ...It was my own decision.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: I thought you wouldn't agree, and I didn't know how to bring it up with Your Highness...
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Why would I not agree, Ascalon? Since it was your decision, I would trust your judgement.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Did you manage to see them?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: ...Manfred and Theresis are both well.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: I can believe that. They're strong men.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: We should finish our preparations soon as well. The operation to retake Kazdel isn't too far off now.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Why does your brow seem even more furrowed than before?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Our recent combat plans have been radical, and they've won us some battles too.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Still, I've been feeling uneasy.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Babel has changed a lot, especially...
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Yes?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The Doctor.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: The Doctor has changed a lot too... become more efficient, more clinical. It's like... the Doctor's now a machine that never makes mistakes.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: That's just what a commander should be, no? Why would that make you worry?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: We've got an incredible commander now, sure... But I think I trust the weirdo who kept falling off a burdenbeast more.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Is now really the best time to attack Kazdel, Your Highness?
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Your intuition has always been on the mark.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: You've had your worries too?
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Do you remember?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: We've faced countless insurmountable odds over the years, but we've overcome them all.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I believe that we can go through what comes next as well.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: We've always been in danger, yes...
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Babel carries the hopes of many, Ascalon. Faith has gotten us this far, and we cannot stop now.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: We have always been at a disadvantage against the Military Commission. Now, most of their forces have redeployed to Londinium. It is a one-of-a-kind opportunity. We have no choice.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I will be at your side, keeping you safe.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: No, Ascalon.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: In the future, you must go further afield, to protect others.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Relax for now, and bask in the sunlight for a moment.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Your Highness...
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Oh, right, remember to not always rest on your feet. If you're tired, you should go and enjoy a nice nap in your room.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I'll remember.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Hm...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The sunlight shines upon Ascalon's face once more.
It is bright and warm. But the moment the shadow faded away, she suddenly felt some peculiar emotion flooding through her chest.
At the time, she was unable to describe what it was. It dawned on her many years later, on another sunny day.
It was an unwillingness to part ways.
Londinium, Victoria
Mercenaries!
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: Message from His Grace the Duke: Storming Londinium like this was well done.
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: Assemble in Central in an hour. You'll be reviewed there, then you'll receive your bounty.
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: Hey! Did you get all that?
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: Yes. Your orders have been received.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Do let the Duke know on my behalf that we will be there on time.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: The Sarkaz thank him for his generosity.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Hmph.
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: Uppity devils...
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: It could well be a rare fine day in Londinium, if it were not for the gun smoke filling the air. From atop the towering city walls, one can see the entire lay of this ancient city.
The General in his bloodstained uniform says not a word, his gaze fixed on the great edifice in the center of the city.
In the skies above Londinium, a dark cloud floats by.
